Articles.Content: I built some custom boosters that provide 5000 delta v for various payload sizes. It just got so repetitive and boring launching modules into LKO that I said screw it and built them. Basically I just figure my payload and build a booster to get it into orbit. It's totally cheating but handy. If there's interest I can make them available. Maybe a handful for a list of payloads?

You can post your craft on kerbalspaceprogram.com or in "The Spacecraft Exchange" subforum under "General KSP".

On second thought, it's probably a mod. You can also try here.

Edited March 19, 2014 by Claw

RedDevilEA, I'm not clear about what you're offering as well. If you've got a ship made up, why not add some pics and a craft file to your first post there, and we'll move it to Ship Exchange for you? Or if it's a mod you're talking about, you could offer it in the add-on releases sub-forum. What is it you have in mind?
When you say it's cheating, what do you mean?

What I mean is I made some custom parts. So, let's say I built a satellite to orbit Kerbin. It weighs 10 tons. I have one custom part that I can slap on the bottom, like one srb, that has been re - coded to provide exactly 5000 delta v and a starting TWR of 1.5. I can make them for any given payload. I was just wondering if there was any interest in building a few standard sizes and putting them out there. I worked out the math (with a little help in one of my previous posts) and it works perfectly.
I guess I just figured this would be a good place to ask since this forum is likely to have some frustrated players. My apologies if that was misguided.
So, if I understand you correctly, they're stock parts for which you've edited the .cfg files?

To answer your initial question: no, I would not use them. Half the fun of KSP is the engineering part to build stuff that works (or fails in a spectacular way) - at least for me.

No offense, but this is like adding a full-auto Railgun to Quake -> cheating

Go ahead, release it (I suppose its a mod). Everyone plays this game in a different way, some may want to use this.

Instead, they might as well turn on infinite fuel, slap a cluster of any engine under the payload and go ahead.

So, if I understand you correctly, they're stock parts for which you've edited the .cfg files?

Yep. I can re-skin and re-scale them, but yeah, that's basically it.

Edited March 19, 2014 by RedDevilEA

To answer your initial question: no, I would not use them. Half the fun of KSP is the engineering part to build stuff that works (or fails in a spectacular way) - at least for me.

No offense, but this is like adding a full-auto Railgun to Quake -> cheating

Go ahead, release it (I suppose its a mod). Everyone plays this game in a different way, some may want to use this.

Instead, they might as well turn on infinite fuel, slap a cluster of any engine under the payload and go ahead.

Yeah, like I said, it just got to be so mundane getting modules into orbit that I sort of just automated the LKO portion of the missions. That's all I use them for is getting into LKO, but it is what it is, I guess.
Don't let anybody tell you how to play your single-player game. If getting to LKO is boring enough for you that you don't have fun designing boosters, then by all means, skip to the fun parts.

Don't let anybody tell you how to play your single-player game. If getting to LKO is boring enough for you that you don't have fun designing boosters, then by all means, skip to the fun parts.

Oh, I will, believe me. It's actually been a lot of fun figuring out how to do it. I'm still designing my rockets, but I'm doing them from the point of view of a parts manufacturer, I guess. The math is a lot of fun to work out. And then I model them and load them up. I'm going to just make a set and put them out there. If they get legs, great. If not, I'm still going to have fun building them.

Just use hyper edit

My thoughts exactly. If you're bored with the whole design & launch phase of the game, just skip it.
Never, that would take the competition from the game.
Hmm. I'd make a plugin to make this booster procedural. When .24 is here, these boosters could be very expensive to provide some balance.
I feel that if they were scaled properly in size and full/dry masses, and with sensible ISPs, they'd be seen as reasonable.
There are mods that provide pre-made rockets in a large range of payload capacities, with fairings and all the fancy stuff, and minimum fuss. You can use one of those.
